title: Add OS tracking, connection instructions, and plan management with expiration dates

requirements.summary: Update client registration form to include operating system dropdown and plan expiration date picker
acceptanceCriteria: ClientRegistrationForm component includes OS dropdown with Windows/Ubuntu options
ClientRegistrationForm component includes date picker for plan expiration
Form submits OS and expiration date to backend when creating new clients

file_operations.description: Add operating system dropdown field with Windows/Ubuntu options using shadcn/ui Select component. Add plan expiration date picker using shadcn/ui Calendar/Popover components. Update form state to include operatingSystem and planExpiry fields. Modify form submission to pass operatingSystem (as OperatingSystem enum) and planExpiry (as Time/bigint timestamp) to the createClientRecord backend function. Ensure proper type mapping between form values and backend interface types.

requirements.summary: Update client edit modal to allow editing operating system and plan expiration date
acceptanceCriteria: ClientEditModal component includes OS dropdown field
ClientEditModal component includes date picker for plan expiration
Modal saves updated OS and expiration date to backend

file_operations.description: Add operating system dropdown field with Windows/Ubuntu options using shadcn/ui Select component. Add plan expiration date picker using shadcn/ui Calendar/Popover components. Initialize form with existing operatingSystem and planExpiry values from the client record. Update form submission to include operatingSystem and planExpiry in the updateClientRecord backend call. Ensure proper handling of OperatingSystem enum values and Time/bigint conversion.

requirements.summary: Display SSH connection instructions on client dashboard when operating system is Ubuntu
acceptanceCriteria: Client dashboard shows SSH instructions card when OS is Ubuntu
Instructions include SSH command format using the VPS IP and username
Instructions include clear step-by-step connection guidance

file_operations.description: Create a new card component that displays SSH connection instructions for Ubuntu users. Include a title 'SSH Connection Instructions', a mini explanation of SSH, and step-by-step instructions. Display the SSH command format using the client's VPS IP and username (e.g., 'ssh {userVps}@{ipVps}'). Include steps: 1) Open terminal, 2) Run the SSH command, 3) Enter VPS password when prompted. Use shadcn/ui Card components for consistent styling with the dark theme. Accept ipVps and userVps as props.

Import and conditionally render the SshInstructionsCard component when the client's operatingSystem field equals 'ubuntu'. Pass the ipVps and userVps values from the clientRecord to the component. Position the card appropriately within the dashboard layout, ensuring it appears alongside other relevant client information like VPS credentials.

requirements.summary: Display RDP connection instructions on client dashboard when operating system is Windows
acceptanceCriteria: Client dashboard shows RDP instructions card when OS is Windows
Instructions include how to open Remote Desktop Connection
Instructions include step-by-step guidance using the VPS IP and credentials

file_operations.description: Create a new card component that displays RDP connection instructions for Windows users. Include a title 'RDP Connection Instructions', a mini explanation of Remote Desktop Protocol, and step-by-step instructions. Include steps: 1) Press Windows + R and type 'mstsc', 2) Enter the VPS IP address, 3) Click Connect, 4) Enter VPS username and password when prompted. Use shadcn/ui Card components for consistent styling with the dark theme. Accept ipVps, userVps, and senhaVps as props for display in instructions.

Import and conditionally render the RdpInstructionsCard component when the client's operatingSystem field equals 'windows'. Pass the ipVps, userVps, and senhaVps values from the clientRecord to the component. Position the card appropriately within the dashboard layout alongside other client information.

requirements.summary: Display client's plan name and expiration date in user profile section on client dashboard
acceptanceCriteria: Client dashboard profile section displays the plan name
Client dashboard profile section displays the plan expiration date
Expiration date is formatted in a user-friendly way (e.g., 'Valid until Jan 15, 2025')

file_operations.description: Add display of plan name and plan expiration date within the profile dropdown menu. Fetch the current clientRecord from useClientAuth context to access the plano and planExpiry fields. Format the planExpiry timestamp (bigint) to a readable date string using JavaScript Date methods (e.g., 'Valid until Jan 15, 2025'). Display plan information below the client name and ID, maintaining consistent styling with existing profile elements.
